items.title: AFP believes Bondi attack gunmen operated alone
items.description: AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett says there is no evidence the men were instructed to carry out the attack, which left 15 people dead.

items.title: Women wearing hijabs targeted in anti-Muslim abuse since Bondi attack
items.description: There are concerns women wearing hijabs are bearing the brunt of a "horrifying" wave of Islamophobia in the wake of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, with the Australian National Imams Council reporting a rise of hate incidents.

items.title: A plane vanished without trace in 2014. Now new tech is looking for MH370
items.description: Malaysia Airlines missing flight MH370, which vanished in 2014, remains one of aviation's enduring mysteries. A new search, beginning today, is aiming to provide answers.

items.title: Price of precious metal used in electronics and cars collapses
items.description: The price of palladium — used in electronics — tumbles from recent highs while the prices of other precious metals, including gold and silver, have also sharply declined in recent days.

items.title: Darwin chef sentenced over role as 'Uber driver' for people smugglers
items.description: A brazen example of people smuggling has been recounted in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, after three Chinese nationals made it into Darwin Harbour on a small wooden fishing boat.

items.title: Passengers begin journey home as cruise ship remains stuck on PNG reef
items.description: Passengers of an Australian cruise ship that ran aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea have begun their journey home, as efforts to free the ship remain unsuccessful.

items.title: Sydney factory destroyed as dozens of firefighters battle huge blaze
items.description: More than 60 firefighters with 20 trucks were called to a factory in Greenacre just before 3pm on Tuesday.

items.title: China's message to international 'scoundrels' was directed at the US
items.description: While Donald Trump was distracted, China launched its strongest-ever challenge against Taiwan. Beijing is showing it is ready for war.

items.title: Attacking Putin's home would be 'stupid' move by Ukraine, say experts
items.description: A defence analyst tells the ABC an attack on the Russian President's state residence would be "technically" possible but would not make sense strategically for Ukraine.

items.title: How the early Boxing Day Test finish spread far beyond the MCG
items.description: The economic and social impact of the Boxing Day Test reaches far past the pitch and the repercussions of the two-day finish rippled all across Melbourne.

items.title: 'Incredibly lucky' bushwalker survives bites from giant brown snake
items.description: A woman hiking on the NSW south coast has survived being bitten twice by an eastern brown snake more than 2 metres long.

items.title: 'Threatened with a huge axe': Police search for carjacker who broke into Victorian home
items.description: Police are combing eastern Victorian bushland for a man they allege broke into a house with an axe and stole multiple cars in the Latrobe Valley.

items.title: First female Bangladesh prime minister dies age 80
items.description: Begum Khaleda Zia was leader of the main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party which was seen as the frontrunner to win the next parliamentary election in February.

items.title: Australian laws changed in six important ways in 2025
items.description: From food delivery to sovereign citizens, Australia's laws underwent some important changes this year.

items.title: Donald Bradman's baggy green to go under the hammer
items.description: A baggy green worn by Sir Donald Bradman during the 1947-48 series against India has gone to auction.

items.title: After 20 years missing in action, ASIC has found its teeth
items.description: After 20 years in the wilderness, the Australian Securities and Investments Commission's rehabilitation as a law enforcement agency seems almost complete.

items.title: Rhinestones and resistance: The history of Blak burlesque in Australia
items.description: Bizzi Lavelle, a Queer Wakka Wakka and Arrernte writer and burlesque dancer known in the scene as Bizzi Body, is reclaiming the hidden legacy of this art-form one tassel twirl at a time.

items.title: An Australian cruise ship ran aground in PNG. Here's what we know
items.description: The Coral Adventurer was carrying 80 tourists into the remote reaches of Papua New Guinea when it came to an abrupt halt on a reef off the Pacific nation's coast.

items.title: Josh Burns to take rare extended parental leave from parliament next year
items.description: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

items.title: Police given extra search powers at all Adelaide public transport sites
items.description: Police have been given expanded powers to search people for weapons on every public bus, train and tram in the Adelaide metropolitan area ahead of New Year Eve's celebrations.

items.title: Big bank convinced communications watchdog to delay revealing damaging news
items.description: The Commonwealth Bank persuaded a key regulator to delay announcing it had broken spam laws until after its AGM, new documents reveal.

items.title: 'Gone off like a rocket': Households cash in on battery rebate
items.description: Battery uptake is booming since the federal government rebate came into effect in July. Here's what you need to know if you are thinking of joining the thousands of Australians adding a battery to their home solar systems.

items.title: Looking back at the news that captured your attention in 2025
items.description: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

items.title: Your soft plastic bags can once again be recycled. Here's how
items.description: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

items.title: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree are full of scammers. Here is how to avoid them
items.description: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.
